text: yeah hi I'm hunter Lewis we're here in
the v8s kitchen with chef Andrea loosing
a lantern restaurant in my hometown
Chapel Hill North Carolina chef thanks
for coming in thanks for having me so
you're gonna cook a recipe out of their
new book cooking in the moment it's a
very personal book with some great
recipes we're gonna do one of your favor
us with shrimp pea and rice stew yeah
okay let's get started
all right these shrimp are from Georgia
they're beautiful big shrimp here's some
ramps asparagus green garlic some
cilantro pea greens which are the
immature tendrils before peas become
peas garden peas shallots Carolina gold
rice from Anson Mills fish sauce sugar
salt black pepper and some oil so now
our shrimp are salt cleaned it took
about five minutes we've rinsed them off
and now we're gonna cut them in half
lengthwise these are big shrimp who'd
you have to do a favor for to get these
shrimp so now I think we're ready to go
in the pan after we get these
ingredients prepped this is the kind of
dish that really can just take whatever
you want to throw at it especially in
the springtime we've had these shrimp
now marinating with the shallots sugar
salt and black pepper for about 20
minutes and we're just gonna give them a
little saute if you were doing this with
long grain rice you would just break it
up in a spice grinder and a mortar and
pestle these are about a third the size
of a normal grain of rice and then we're
gonna just let this cook for a little
bit and then add some water
I love soups that you don't have to use
a stock you're using water so you
actually taste the shrimp and you taste
the shallots and the fish sauce exactly
so we're just gonna let it cook okay
we're gonna add the peas and the peas
will take about two minutes to cook if
you were using frozen peas you would
just put them in and just proceed with
the recipe because they cook a lot
faster now we're gonna add the little
asparagus pieces
the green growth the ramps and the
cilantro kind of wait for the end for
those okay so now our peas are just
about tender and the asparagus are a
little bit soft and the green garlic is
pretty soft and we're gonna add the
ramps and they're kind of roughly
chopped up pea greens and then at the
very end we're gonna stir in some
chopped up cilantro but mint would be
really good basil would be nice Thai
basil and then just a little black
pepper so there you have it
shrimp rice and pea stew from chef and
rear oozing of the lantern restaurant in
Chapel Hill North Carolina
it's amazing good taste of spring thank
you so much for coming into the VA
kitchen today about me I love being here
thank you so much and this is really
